Package soc.client

Interface Summary
ColorSquareListener Listen for changes to the value of the color square, when a user clicks or a setter is called.
 

Class Summary
AccountClient Applet/Standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer and making user accounts.
AskDialog This is the generic dialog to ask players a two- or three-choice question; to present a one-button message, see NotifyDialog.
AWTClickTester Testing for cross-platform context-click (right-click); standalone class.
AWTToolTip A short tooltip for a component.
BoardPanel This is a component that can display a Settlers of Catan Board.
BuildingPanel This class is a panel that shows how much it costs to build things, and it allows the player to build.
ChannelFrame The chat channel window
ColorSquare This is a square box with a background color and possibly a number, checkmark, or text in it.
ColorSquareLarger This is a larger square box with a background color and possibly a number or X in it.
ConnectOrPracticePanel This is the dialog for standalone client startup (JAR or otherwise) if no command-line arguments.
DisplaylessPlayerClient GUI-less standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer.
FaceButton This is a component that can display a face.
FaceChooserFrame Popup window for the user to browse and choose a face icon.
HandPanel This panel displays a player's information.
NewGameOptionsFrame This is the dialog for options to set in a new game.
PlayerClient Applet/Standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer.
PlayerClient.GameOptionServerSet Track the server's valid game option set.
PlayerInterface Window with interface for a player in one game of Settlers of Catan.
ShadowedBox This is a shadowed box for use in the hand panel
SnippingTextArea Limits lines displayed to MaximumLines.
SpeechBalloon This is a rectangular speech balloon shape for use in the hand panel.
SquaresPanel Display grid of give/get resources for trade and bank/port offers.
StatisticsClient Applet/Standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer, viewing human and robot statistics, and reseting statics for a human.
StatisticsClient.StatisticsTableModel Declare table model for statistics data
TradeOfferPanel Two-mode panel to display either a short status message, or a resource trade offer (and counter-offer).
